title: It's FA Cup third round day - here's how to follow all the action on the BBC
description: The FA Cup third round - when Premier League and Championship teams enter - takes place this weekend and you can follow all the action on the BBC.

title: Wasps run in seven tries to beat Bath in 96-point game
description: Wasps run in seven of the 11 tries at The Rec as they beat Bath in a game of almost 100 points to claim a fifth straight win.

title: Covid: Fines reviewed after women 'surrounded by police'
description: Two women were fined £200 after driving five miles to walk around Foremark Reservoir, Derbyshire.

title: Lockdown lessons: The firms adapting and thriving
description: Three small businesses explain how they have adapted to cope with the pandemic over the past year.

title: Capitol riots: The hunt to identify and arrest Capitol rioters
description: The FBI is appealing to the public for help in bringing rioters to justice. Will this approach work?

title: How protests swept across the US
description: While rioters in Washington DC made headlines, Trump supporters rallied at state capitols throughout the US.

title: 'I proposed while in the ICU with Covid'
description: Jonathan nearly died from Covid but his story has a very happy ending.

title: Coronavirus: 'Major incident' declared in London by Sadiq Khan
description: The mayor says one in 30 Londoners has Covid-19, as he declares a "major incident".

title: Covid-19: Travellers to UK will need to show negative test result
description: International travellers will have to take a Covid test up to 72 hours before departing.

title: 'Morally wrong' to keep playing amid increasing Covid outbreaks - Bruce
description: Newcastle boss Steve Bruce says it is "morally wrong" to continue with football amid increasing coronavirus outbreaks at clubs.

title: Surge in pupils at school in lockdown sparks call for limit
description: With attendance as high as 50% in some areas, heads call for pupil limits in England's lockdown schools.

title: Covid: Women on exercise trip 'surrounded by police'
description: The two women were given £200 fixed penalty notices after driving five miles to go on a walk.

title: Were there hold-ups in first week after Brexit?
description: Low traffic at borders has meant there have been few problems in Kent, but there have been other issues.

title: Moderna becomes third Covid vaccine approved in the UK
description: Seventeen million doses have been ordered by the UK and are expected to arrive in spring.

title: 'Racist and sexist' Hampshire police unit officers dismissed
description: Secret recordings revealed "enough profanity, casual sexism and racism to last a lifetime".

title: Root finds form as Anderson misses out on hat-trick in England warm-up
description: Captain Joe Root hits an unbeaten 74 and Dan Lawrence 46 not out in England's first intra-squad match before the Test series in Sri Lanka.

title: IGCSE exams taken in private schools still going ahead
description: While GCSEs and A-levels are cancelled, IGCSEs, often used in independent schools, will continue.

title: Covid-19: Bereaved brother warns young not to ignore symptoms
description: James Jordan said if he had called NHS 111, his brother, 36, would "probably still be with us".

title: Capitol riots: Questions mount over security failure
description: The violent breach has sparked serious concerns in Washington and beyond.

title: 'Human foot' in Gateshead field turns out to be potato
description: A worried dog walker alerted police but officers say she was right to remain vigilant.

title: Hunt for fake vaccine fraudster who injected woman, 92, in Surbiton
description: The man charged the 92-year-old £160 and came back a week later asking for a further £100.

title: Villa v Liverpool FA Cup tie on despite Covid outbreak
description: Aston Villa's FA Cup third-round tie with Liverpool is to go ahead despite a Covid-19 outbreak at the host club.

title: Dry January: Will lockdown cause more people to give in?
description: People have been drinking more during the pandemic. Will the new lockdown foil our Dry January plans?

title: 'You can't cage a lion for too long' - Smith ends 16-month wait for Test hundred
description: India reach 96-2 after Steve Smith's 131 helps Australia's post 338 on day two of the third Test in Sydney.

title: European tournaments in doubt over French government's Covid-19 concerns
description: The future of this season's European cup competitions is in doubt as the French government debates whether their clubs can finish group games.

title: Ashli Babbitt: The US vet shot dead breaking into the Capitol
description: The 35-year-old is one of five people who died amid an armed insurrection at the US Capitol.

title: Soaring house prices in 2020 likely to slow this year, says Halifax
description: The lender says it expects "downward pressure on house prices" in 2021 following annual rise of 6% last year.

title: West Ham sell record signing Haller to Ajax
description: West Ham's record signing Sebastien Haller joins Dutch side Ajax but the Hammers expect to bring in a replacement.

title: Covid: The challenge in speeding up France's vaccination drive
description: As France seeks to speed up its coronavirus vaccination programme, it battles fear and distrust.

title: The airman from Sierra Leone who was shot down over Nazi Germany
description: The amazing life of Johnny Smythe - RAF officer, prisoner of war and a father of the Windrush generation.

title: Building frozen castles at China's Harbin Ice Festival
description: Towering ice structures feature at the Harbin International Ice and Snow Sculpture Festival.

title: US Capitol riot: 'It was like a zombie movie'
description: Photographer Jim Lo Scalzo captured the chaos when a mob of President Trump supporters stormed the US Capitol.

title: 'Why I quit my job after my home burned down'
description: After surviving a bushfire that destroyed his house, Jack quit his job to become a climate activist.

title: Covid-19: What happens if hospitals are overwhelmed?
description: How do hospitals become overwhelmed and what can be done to stop it from happening.

title: A Michael Jackson concert in India that's now tax-free
description: The government decision to waive tax for the 1996 concert led to a court battle that dragged on until now.

title: Greener planes of the future... or just pretty plans?
description: The aerospace industry is testing models of radical looking aircraft, but will they ever make it into production?

title: Food waste: 'I'll have to throw away £6,000-worth of milk'
description: While restaurants and shops have been given tax breaks, firms that supply them fear for the future.
